I've used Cantera 1.5.msi before and i had no problem using Matlab 
with Cantera when i followed the instructions from the installation 
procedure shown on powerpoint.  I'm using Cantera 1.5.1.tar however 
now so that i can modify the source code some.  Python seems to be 
working fine.  I found some documetation on how to configure matlab 
to run with Cantera.  The mex -setup seemed to work, i also add all 
the paths needed by Matlab.  However when i run tut1.m i get the 
follwing error message:

 ??? Undefined function or variable 'ctmethods'.

Error in ==> c:\documents and settings\shenders\my documents\cantera-
1.5.1\cantera\matlab\cantera\@XML_Node\XML_Node.m
On line 10  ==>    x.id = ctmethods(10,15,0,src); % newxml(name)

Error in ==> c:\documents and settings\shenders\my documents\cantera-
1.5.1\cantera\matlab\cantera\@Solution\Solution.m
On line 30  ==> doc = XML_Node('doc',src);

Error in ==> c:\documents and settings\shenders\my documents\cantera-
1.5.1\cantera\matlab\cantera\GRI30.m
On line 22  ==>   s = Solution('gri30.cti','gri30');

Error in ==> c:\documents and settings\shenders\my documents\cantera-
1.5.1\cantera\matlab\cantera\tutorial\tut1.m
On line 10  ==> gas1 = GRI30

I also built project 'ct' and this seemed to work also. The 
setup_matlab.py file also gives an error also:

IDLE 1.0      ==== No Subprocess ====
>>> 
usage: python setup_matlab.py <bindir> <libdir> <lib>
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "C:\Documents and Settings\shenders\My Documents\cantera-1.5.1
\Cantera\matlab\setup_matlab.py", line 10, in ?
    sys.exit(0)
SystemExit: 0

I believe this is why Matlab is not working properly.
Any help would be greatly appreciated.

Thank You,
Sean Henderson
